list_definition.definition: a strip of leather or piece of chain attached to a collar round its neck by which a dog etc is held

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Terry let the dog off the leash.

list_ex_of_english: I do not believe that the public are straining at the leash for another election.
The railways have been required to operate on a short leash, and that is simply not the way forward.
We could see her straining at the leash, and we naturally expected that she was going to knoch his arguments flat.
Although we are talking about dogs on leashes, we must couple that with dogs which roam.
Are they really to be financed by the pharmaceutical industry and kept on a leash?
The dogs are on the leash barking madly, knowing what is to come.
I am sure that he will be straining at the leash to make a contribution to this debate.
Local government in this country is like a dog kept on a tight leash.
